abstract.text: Fetches all modified records from a specific record zone and returns them to an awaiting caller.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The identifier of the record zone with changes.
The change token from the previous execution of this method. If this is your app’s first fetch, or you want to refetch every change in the record zone’s history, specify
The fields to include on each fetched record. To include all fields, specify
; to fetch only system fields, specify an empty array.
The maximum number of changes to return. The server may use a limit lower than this value.
A tuple with the following named elements:
A dictionary of record modifications that occur after the time that
denotes. The dictionary uses the identifiers of modified records as its keys. The value of each key is a
that contains either the corresponding modification, or an error that describes why CloudKit can’t provide that information.
An array of record deletions that occur after the time that
denotes. Each deletion contains details about a deleted record.
The change token that corresponds to the fetch results’ most recent change.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the server has additional changes for you to fetch.

This method fetches record changes in the specfied record zone, such as those that occur during record creation, modification, and deletion. It throws an error if the request fails, such as when the network is unavailable or the device doesn’t have an active iCloud account; otherwise, the returned tuple includes any individual record errors.
Along with the fetched changes, CloudKit supplies a
, which is an opaque token that denotes a specific point in the record zone’s history. Store this token and provide it the next time you execute this method. Change tokens conform to
and are safe to cache on-disk. Don’t infer any behavior or order from a token’s contents.
For information on a more configurable way to fetch record zone changes, see

abstract.text: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that all users of your app can share.
An object that represents a collection of record zones and subscriptions.
Objects that indicate the type of database change.
Objects that indicate the type of record zone change.
A record zone change that represents the deletion of a record.
A record zone change that represents the modification of a record.
Fetches all modified record zones and returns them to an awaiting caller.
Fetches all modified record zones and delivers them to a completion handler.
Fetches all modified records from a specific record zone and delivers them to a completion handler.
Fetches all modified records from a specific record zone and returns them to an awaiting caller.
An operation that fetches record zone changes.
A collection of key-value pairs that store your app’s data.
The data type that CloudKit requires for record field names.
An object that uniquely identifies a record in a database.
A database partition that contains related records.
An object that uniquely identifies a record zone in a database.
An opaque token that represents a specific point in a database’s history.
A value that represents either a success or a failure, including an associated value in each case.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
A value that represents either a success or a failure, including an associated value in each case.
